alert.note: Alert for Kootenai; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 6:22PM MST until March 04 at 12:29AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Kootenai and Shoshone Counties. .The river is rising quickly this evening (TUE) in response to the recent rains and warm weather increasing snowmelt. Rain will spread into North Idaho tonight and continue at varying intensities through Thursday. For the Coeur d`Alene River...including Cataldo...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo. * WHEN...From this evening to late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 43.0 feet, Minor flooding of farmland from Cataldo downstream to Harrison is likely. The campground at Cataldo will also begin to flood. Portions of Dudley Road, west of Latour Creek, will likely be underwater and impassable. If there is significant water already in the floodplain, these impacts may occur at lower stages. Old Coeur d`Alene River Road on the North Fork of the Coeur d`Alene River may begin to flood north of the Bumblebee Bridge. At 44.0 feet, Homes near the river may experience some flooding of basements. Water will begin to cover CCC Road near the Mennonite Church. Some water will be over the section of Latour Creek Road immediately south of Interstate 90, near the campground. Due to the high water table some homes behind the Cataldo levee will be surrounded by water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 42.0 feet. - The river is rising is experiencing swift rises in response to recent rains and increased snowmelt. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 43.6 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 43.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (4 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Coeur d Alene River Cataldo 43.0 42.0 Tue 4 pm PST 43.5 42.8 42.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued early Wednesday morning.Wednesday morning at 600 AM PST.
